text: the phrase we need to talk or come by my
office I need to talk to you is
problematic because it's fraught with
ambiguity this is particularly fraud
when we have a situation with someone
with more power and someone with less
power so imagine you say to someone hey
come by my office I really want to talk
to you later today and that person is
less power than you they start running
in their mind all these scenarios of
something they did wrong that you're mad
at them that you're upset with them and
we call this the power amplification
effect so the ambiguity in that sentence
gets amplified when someone has power
even in our closest relationships with
you know our spouses or romantic
partners we're constantly having to find
a balance between the tension between
cooperation and competition and we're
also trying to find that balance of
power in these types of relationships
and so one person says to the other I
need to talk to you they're going to
have the same type of reactions and if a
ball said I need to talk to you and so
that phrase I need to talk to you comes
with it often fraught with pretentious
and ominous meaning and sometimes it is
pretentious ominous and sometimes we
need to express that but other times we
need to lay people's fears and
insecurities so what should you do when
you tell someone you need to talk to
them when you have more power than you
should either tell them it's not a big
deal don't worry about it or give them
some indication what it is if it is a
big deal or just tell them what it is if
it's really easy to resolve you know
right then and so whether it's in the
boardroom or the bedroom the phrase I
need to talk to you is always going to
be fraught and we want to use it
judiciously only in those moments where
we really intend to send that ominous
pretentious meaning otherwise we need to
find another way to communicate why we
need to speak to someone
